p: The meteorological forcing of the WALRUS model consisted of daily precipitation and potential evapotranspiration time series. The daily precipitation time series involved time series of precipitation averages for each subcatchment respectively, which were estimated from gridded (1 × 1 km 2) precipitation data of the Royal Dutch Meteorological Institute (KNMI) for the period 2000–2010 (KNMI 2016). Potential evapotranspiration (PET) time series were constructed as averages for each subcatchment. These averages were estimated by adjusting the daily Makkink ( 1957) reference evapotranspiration with a combination of crop factors and land use information. The reference evapotranspiration was extracted from the Eindhoven meteorological station for the period 2000–2010. Land use information was derived from the CORINE land cover dataset (Bossard et al. 2000) for Belgium and the STONE database (Van Bakel et al. 2008) for the Netherlands. Table 1 provides an overview of the model input data for the WALRUS and metal transport modules.
